# stopTrackedRaycasts

**Type Property**

An option to stop all active tracked raycasts.

## Declaration

```swift
static var stopTrackedRaycasts: ARSession.RunOptions { get }
```

## Discussion

By default, when you call the [doc://com.apple.arkit/documentation/ARKit/ARSession/run(_:options:)] method on a session that is running or has run before, the session keeps tracking any [doc://com.apple.arkit/documentation/ARKit/ARTrackedRaycast] objects that you previously added by calling [doc://com.apple.arkit/documentation/ARKit/ARSession/trackedRaycast(_:updateHandler:)].

Use [doc://com.apple.arkit/documentation/ARKit/ARSession/RunOptions/stopTrackedRaycasts] if you want to stop all active tracked raycasts. Alternatively, you can stop individual raycasts by calling [doc://com.apple.arkit/documentation/ARKit/ARTrackedRaycast/stopTracking()] on individual raycasts.

## Run Options

- **resetTracking**: An option to reset the device’s position from the session’s previous run.
- **removeExistingAnchors**: An option to remove any anchor objects associated with the session’s previous run.
- **resetSceneReconstruction**: An option to reset the scene mesh.
